About

Guide on the Side helps you to quickly and easily create online, interactive tutorials based on the principles of authentic and active learning. Know how to use Word? You already know how to use Guide on the Side. Here are some of the tutorials weâ€™ve made here at the University of Arizona Libraries:

  • Google Scholar - Popup Demo
  • Wikipedia Demo
  • Searching the Library Catalog

View all tutorials created by users trying out Guide on the Side.

Try the Creator Interface

To get full access to try out the application, excluding administrative rights:

Contact us to request a demo acount: lbry-gots@email.arizona.edu

Already have a demo account? Sign in here.

Get this for your Library

To install the application at your institution, you need the skills, access and resources that are common to installing a web application. Specific requirements and more detailed information on that is available in the README file. If you’re in Arizona and you’re not able to host the application at your institution, we may be able to help. Please send us an email at lbry-gots@email.arizona.edu for more details.

We’ve developed a user guide to help you get started and a style guide that can help ensure a consistent experience across all tutorials at your institution.

Ready to go?

Download our packaged 1.0-beta4
(recommended, includes the required CakePHP framework)

or

Clone our repository on GitHub

Get Involved

We appreciate your interest in GotS and encourage you to get involved in the user community! We’d love to hear about your favorite tutorials and the best practices that you've developed at your institution.

  • Discuss and give input on Guide on the Side by joining our Google Group.
  • Report bugs, request features or contribute development work through our Github issue queue.
